entry.tran: 不切实际的;不现实的;不可行的
entry.def: If you describe an object, idea, or course of action as impractical, you mean that it is not sensible or realistic, and does not work well in practice.

example.ex: When stalking subjects, a tripod is impractical...
example.tran: 潜步跟踪目标时,用三脚架是不切实际的。

example.ex: It became impractical to make a business trip by ocean liner.
example.tran: 乘坐远洋班轮进行商务旅行变得不合时宜了。

entry.tran: 无动手能力的;无实践能力的
entry.def: If you describe someone as impractical, you mean that they do not have the abilities or skills to do practical work such as making, repairing, or organizing things.

example.ex: Geniuses are supposed to be eccentric and hopelessly impractical.
example.tran: 天才通常都被认为行为古怪而且毫无实践能力。

means.word_mean: 1. not practical; not workable or not given to practical matters;

sentences.sentence: "refloating the ship proved impractical because of the expense"
"he is intelligent but too impractical for commercial work"

auth_sentence.content: It's impossible and impractical until somebody builds it.

means.word_mean: 不切实际的, 无用的, 不现实的

sentences.en: An entirely rigid system is impractical.
sentences.cn: 一套完全死板的体制是不实际的。

sentences.en: To expect automatic protection from the police is impractical.
sentences.cn: 期望警方自动提供保护是不现实的。

sentences.en: He rejected my suggestion as impractical.
sentences.cn: 他以不切实际为由拒绝了我的建议。
这样一种解决方法证明是不切实际的。

sentences.en: He was hopelessly impractical when it came to planning new projects.
sentences.cn: 一到规划新项目，他就完全没有了实际操作的能力。

sentences.en: Men aggravate me when they go on about how impractical women are.
sentences.cn: 男人们不断地谈论女人是如何不切实际的时候使我恼火。

sentences.en: My original intention was to study all morning, but this turned out to be impractical.
sentences.cn: 我原本打算整个上午都学习，可是后来发现行不通。
